oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Harpers Weekly edition featuring the engagement at Fort Sanders
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Dramatic engravings of Confederate Gen. James Longstreet's Nov. 29, 1863 assault on Fort Sanders from the January 9, 1864 edition of Harper's Weekly. Ft. Sanders was an earthen salient fort, designed by Capt. Orlando Poe, at the southwestern corner of the Union defensive line around Knoxville. The Confederate assault in the early morning hours quickly bogged down in front of the fort's sloping walls and became a disastrous defeat leading to Longstreet's withdrawal.
